title: Germanic script
content:
Hi, wondered if anybody could give any information on this piece of lettering.  
It's German — 19/20th century. I'm sure somebody could enlighten me  
and perhaps point me in the direction of some accurate digital specimens?

Many thanks  
Pete

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [German specimen.jpeg](http://web.archive.org/web/20140724130435/http:/typophile.com/files/82500529_d35d899927_z.jpeg) | 136.78 KB |
author: alphapeta

comments.content: The lettering is essentially German handwriting, so there may not be an original typeface upon which it was based…

Key word is [Kurrent](http://web.archive.org/web/20140724130435/http:/en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kurrent), sometimes also named with the improper term as [Sütterlin](http://web.archive.org/web/20140724130435/http:/en.wikipedia.org/wiki/S%C3%BCtterlin).
Ah, that's great. Thank you Renko.
The image spells »Städtisches Kinderheim«, which means »Urban childrens home« if I’m not mistaken.
Ah, ok that's perfect. It's the basis for a new logo for a well-known brand.

The above photo is from [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kurrent](http://web.archive.org/web/20140724130435/http:/en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kurrent "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kurrent")

Sütterlin fonts are available, for example, from here:

[http://www.suetterlinschrift.de/Lese/Sutterlin0.htm](http://web.archive.org/web/20140724130435/http:/www.suetterlinschrift.de/Lese/Sutterlin0.htm "http://www.suetterlinschrift.de/Lese/Sutterlin0.htm")

I’ll also point out our Flickr group with some interesting Kurrent samples:  
 [http://www.flickr.com/groups/kurrentschrift/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140724130435/http:/www.flickr.com/groups/kurrentschrift/ "http://www.flickr.com/groups/kurrentschrift/")

Hi—

Thanks—I found all of this already. Thanks anwyay.
